ul.li1: 1Look! The hand of Yahweh is not too short to save,Literally “from saving”
ul.li2: and his ear is not too dull to hear.Literally “from hearing”
ul.li1: 2Rather, your iniquities have been barriersLiterally “dividers” between you and your God,
ul.li2: and your sins have hidden his face from you, from hearing.
ul.li1: 3For your hands are defiled with blood,
ul.li2: and your fingers with iniquity.
ul.li1: Your lips have spoken lies,
ul.li2: your tongue speaks wickedness.
ul.li1: 4There is nobody who pleads withLiterally “calling in” justice,
ul.li2: and there is nobody who judges with honesty.
ul.li1: They rely on nothing
ul.li2: and speak vanity.
ul.li1: They conceive trouble
ul.li2: and beget iniquity;
ul.li1: 5they hatch viper eggs,
ul.li2: and they weave a spider web.
ul.li1: One who eats their eggs dies,
ul.li2: and that which is pressed is hatched as a serpent.
ul.li1: 6Their webs cannot become clothing,
ul.li2: and they cannot cover themselves with their works.
ul.li1: Their works are works of iniquity,
ul.li2: and deedsHebrew “deed” of violence are in their hands.
ul.li1: 7Their feet run to evil,
ul.li2: and they hasten to shed innocent blood.
ul.li1: Their thoughts are thoughts of iniquity;
ul.li2: devastation and destruction are in their highways.
ul.li1: 8They do not know the way of peace,
ul.li2: and there is no justice in their firm paths.
ul.li1: They have made their paths crooked for themselves;
ul.li2: everyone who walksLiterally “walking” in it knows no peace.
ul.li1: 9Therefore justice is far from us,
ul.li2: and righteousness does not reach us.
ul.li1: We wait for light, butOr “and” look! there is darkness;
ul.li2: for brightness, but we walk in darkness.
ul.li1: 10We grope like the blind along a wall,
ul.li2: and we grope as withoutLiterally “like there are no” eyes.
ul.li1: We stumble at noon as in the twilight;
ul.li2: among the strong we are like the dead.
ul.li1: 11We all groan like bears,
ul.li2: and we coo mutteringly like doves.
ul.li1: We wait for justice, butOr “and” there is none;
ul.li2: for salvation, but it is far from us.
ul.li1: 12For our transgressions are numerous before you,
ul.li2: and our sins testifyOr “answers” against us.
ul.li1: Indeed, our transgressions are with us,
ul.li2: and we know our iniquities:
ul.li1: 13transgressing and denying Yahweh,
ul.li2: and turning away from followingLiterally “back from behind” our God;
ul.li1: speaking oppression and falsehood,
ul.li2: conceiving and uttering words of deception from the heart.
ul.li1: 14And justice is pushed back,
ul.li2: and righteousness stands afar;
ul.li1: for truth stumbles in the public square,
ul.li2: and straightforwardness is unable to enter,
ul.li1: 15and truth is missing,
ul.li2: and he who turns aside from evil is plundered.
ul.li1: And Yahweh saw,
ul.li2: and it was displeasing in his eyes that there was no justice
ul.li1: 16And he saw that there was no man,
ul.li2: and he was appalled that there was no one who intercedes,
ul.li1: soOr “and” his arm came to assist him,
ul.li2: and his righteousness was whatLiterally “it” sustained him.
ul.li1: 17And he put on righteousness like a breastplate,
ul.li2: and a helmet of salvation on his head,
ul.li1: and he put on garments of vengeance for clothing,
ul.li2: and he wrapped himself in zeal as in a robe.
ul.li1: 18According to deeds, so he will repay;
ul.li2: wrath to his enemies, requital to those who are his enemies.Literally “hostile”
He will repay requital to the coastlands.
ul.li1: 19SoOr “And” they shall fear the name of Yahweh from the west,
ul.li2: and his glory from the sunrise,
ul.li1: for he will come like a narrow stream;
ul.li2: the wind of Yahweh drives it on.
ul.li1: 20“And a redeemer will come to Zion,
ul.li2: to those in Jacob who turn away from transgression,”

chapter.p: 21“And as for me, this is my covenant with them, says Yahweh:

ul.li1: my spirit that is upon you,
ul.li2: and my words that I have placed in your mouth
ul.li1: shall not depart from your mouth,
ul.li2: orOr “and” from the mouthsHebrew “mouth” of your children,Literally “offspring”
orOr “and” from the mouthsHebrew “mouth” of your children’s children,”Literally “the offspring of your offspring”
ul.li3: says Yahweh, “from now on and forever.”
